question.body: Which part of the forebrain plays a major role in homeostasis through both the endocrine system and autonomic nervous system?

response.feedback: Incorrect. These cerebral gray matter clusters are involved in modulating motor control.
Incorrect. This is a deep cerebral lobe that appears to play a role in awareness and interpretation of some sensations.

Correct. This region is involved in many homeostatic regulatory mechanisms involving pituitary gland and sympathetic and parasympathetic nerves, as well functions related to emotions and biological cycles.
